title: Epic: Nostr Event Landing Page + References + Caching
description:
Complete implementation of the public /nostr/:id landing page that loads any Nostr event, resolves references, and uses server-side caching for reliability and speed.

## Objective
Deliver a shareable, public event viewer at nostrstack.com/nostr/<event-id> that can render supported Nostr events, resolve references to other events/profiles, and serve data through an API-backed cache.

## Success Criteria
- [ ] /nostr/:id renders for hex IDs plus note/nevent/naddr/npub/nprofile inputs with clear loading/error states.
- [ ] Referenced events/profiles (root/reply/mention/quote/addressable) are resolved and displayed with safe previews.
- [ ] API returns cached results with observable cache hit/miss telemetry; relay fallback works when cache misses.
- [ ] Security validation (input validation, signature checks, safe rendering) is enforced end-to-end.

## Assumptions
- Implement a server-side event resolver + cache in the existing API (Prisma/DB) and have the gallery UI consume it; direct relay fetching remains a fallback.
- Evaluate nostrdb as a future sidecar; do not bind directly to the unstable C API in this epic.
- Reference resolution follows NIP-10/NIP-27 conventions; displayed references are capped to a small, configurable limit.

## Out of Scope
- Full-text search across all events
- SSR/SEO rendering beyond the SPA
- Full thread viewer (beyond referenced events)

title: Epic: Profile Payments + Zap Journey

Complete implementation of a seamless profile payment + zap journey.

Enable a logged-in user to navigate to any profile, send 500 sats via LNURL/NWC/WebLN, and zap multiple posts from feed/profile without leaving the flow.

- [ ] User can open a friend's profile via /p/<npub|hex> and see profile/pay UI.

## Assumptions
- Payments use LNURL-pay (LUD-06) and Lightning Address (LUD-16); profile tips use a NIP-57 zap request with a p-tag (no e-tag).

- Wallet onboarding beyond existing NWC settings.
- Non-lightning payment methods.

title: Lightning: make regtest-lndbits stack self-healing (LND sync + active channel)
description:
Observed: after docker container restarts/kill (exit 137), bitcoind+LNbits can restart with lower height than LND wallets; LND gets stuck with 'Block height out of range' and channels become inactive. Demo payments + pnpm qa:regtest-demo fail until manual steps: load miner wallet, mine blocks to catch up, reconnect peers so channels become active.

Improve scripts/regtest-lndbits.sh to:
- ensure miner wallet is loaded (loadwallet)
- optionally mine blocks until both LND nodes report synced_to_chain=true
- reconnect payer->merchant peer and ensure at least one active channel (or detect inactive and reopen)
- surface actionable diagnostics on failure.

Acceptance: running ./scripts/regtest-lndbits.sh up yields a working pay flow without manual intervention, and qa:regtest-demo passes.

title: Epic: Make It GREAT - Find Friend & Tip
description:
Complete implementation of a first-time "Find Friend & Tip" flow that feels great from landing to payment confirmation.

## Objective
Deliver a guided, low-friction flow for a new user to locate a friend by Nostr identifier, view their profile, zap posts, and send a 500-sat tip with clear confirmation.

- [ ] User can find a friend via npub/nprofile/nip05 input and reach their profile.
- [ ] Tip flow shows clear statuses and success confirmation (including zap receipt vs. payment caveat).
- [ ] End-to-end Playwright flow + video run without console/network errors.

## Assumptions
- Search is identifier-based (npub/nprofile/nip05/lightning address), not full-text global Nostr search.
- First iteration uses an API NIP-05 proxy with in-memory cache; nostrdb integration is deferred.
- Login remains required to sign zap requests; read-only browsing is acceptable.

## Out of Scope
- Global Nostr indexer / graph-based people search.
- Building a full wallet or custodial payments.
- Full nostrdb integration and relay syncing beyond this flow.
